Dear Hiring Manager, 
I want to apply for the Incident and Vulnerability Disclosure 
Coordinator/Analyst position at Luxembourg House of Cybersecurity. With a background 
in IT operations, cybersecurity auditing, and cloud-based monitoring solutions, I am 
eager to contribute my expertise to enhancing incident response and vulnerability 
management processes. 
Operational Security & Incident Management at Alibaba Group (Whale 
Cloud Technologies) 
During my tenure at Alibaba Group (Whale Cloud Technologies), I was responsible 
for Operations & Maintenance (O&M) of the BOSS telecommunication 
software deployed by La Poste Luxembourg. This role involved: 
• Incident Response & Resolution: Streamlining ticketing procedures, 
optimizing incident tracking mechanisms, and reducing ticket resolution time by 
improving documentation and reporting standards. 
• Requirement Analysis & Implementation: Translating client security and 
monitoring requirements into a microservices-based cloud monitoring tool, 
ensuring robust backend security monitoring for the system. 
• Client Training & Technical Documentation: Conducting security and system 
training sessions in German and English, equipping teams with best practices for 
handling cyber incidents and software vulnerabilities. 
IT Auditing & Compliance at KPMG Luxembourg 
At KPMG Luxembourg, I specialized in IT security audits, risk management, and 
compliance frameworks, ensuring adherence to DORA (Digital Operational Resilience 
Act) and CSSF cybersecurity circulars. My role involved: 
• Incident Management Standardization: Establishing structured incident response 
frameworks aligned with DORA regulations to enhance crisis management and 
business continuity. 
• Security & Compliance Assessments: Conducting audits to assess the cyber 
resilience of financial institutions, ensuring compliance with ISO 27001, GDPR, and 
PSD2. 
• Forensic & Vulnerability Analysis: Evaluating cybersecurity threat models, 
identifying vulnerabilities, and recommending mitigation strategies to strengthen 
infrastructure resilience. 
Open-Source Security Tool Development & AI-Based Risk Analysis 
Beyond my professional experience, I have developed AI-driven security tools and open-
source solutions that align with the objectives of Luxembourg House of Cybersecurity: 
• Automated Threat Detection System: Developed a Python-based monitoring 
tool that integrates with Linux servers for real-time vulnerability assessment.

• Cyber Threat Intelligence Newsletter: Built a full-stack newsletter 
platform (HomeSmartify Newsletter) leveraging AI and web scraping to automate 
security intelligence gathering and classify threats in blockchain and cybersecurity 
domains. 
• Fine-Tuning Mistral 7B for Smart-Home Security Advisory: Trained a LLM-
based chatbot using synthetic dialogue datasets, demonstrating expertise in AI 
security applications and automated advisory systems. 
Why Luxembourg House of Cybersecurity? 
I am particularly drawn to this role as it merges my expertise in incident response, 
vulnerability management, and cybersecurity intelligence with my passion for open-
source tool development and AI-driven security solutions. My experience 
in standardizing security frameworks, automating threat monitoring, and conducting 
forensic analysisaligns well with the position’s objectives. 
I would welcome the opportunity to discuss how my experience can contribute to enhancing 
cybersecurity incident coordination at LHC. Thank you for your time and consideration—I 
look forward to your response. 
Best regards, 
Ruiqi Tan
